prompt.p: A 28-year-old woman presents with muscle weakness in the shoulders and hips. She complains of feeling hot, sweaty and restless. She has had diarrhoea and no menses for the last 3 months. She has no previous medical history. On examination her pulse is 123 beats/min and irregular. Neurological examination reveals brisk tendon reflexes.
What is the cause of her proximal myopathy?

modalFeedback.p: Option D (Hyperthyroidism) is Correct. Increased thyroxine increases cellular basal metabolic rate. Features of thyrotoxicosis include sweating, heat intolerance, weightloss, amenhorrea, diahhorrea, tachycardia, atrial fibrillation, proximal myopathy with brisk tenon reflexes.
Option A (Alcoholic myopathy) is Incorrect. There are no features of liver disease in this patient.
Option B (Cushing's disease) is Incorrect. There are no features of Cushing's disease in this patient.
Option C (Diabetes mellitus) is Incorrect. There are no features of diabetes mellitus in this patient.
Option E (Motor neuron disease) is Incorrect. There are no signs of motor neuron disease in this patient.
